thread.title: Protesters block tunnel into Heathrow Airport
thread.title_full: Protesters block tunnel into Heathrow Airport

title: Protesters block tunnel into Heathrow Airport
text:
Protesters block tunnel into Heathrow Airport   copyright Rising Up! Image caption The tunnel approach to Terminals 2 and 3 and the M4 spur road was closed The main approach tunnel to Heathrow Airport was blocked by protesters objecting to plans for a third runway. 
Three cars were parked across the road, with protesters chaining themselves to one of the vehicles at about 08:30 GMT. 
The tunnel, which accesses Terminals 2 and 3, remains closed along with the M4 spur road and diversions have been put in place, causing widespread delays. 
Two people have been arrested on suspicion of obstructing a highway, the Metropolitan Police said. 
A spokesman for the Rising Up! protest group said it was protesting against the impact a proposed third runway could have on climate change and the local area. 
Heathrow Airport said it was working with authorities to resolve the issue. 
An airport spokesman said: "Heathrow supports the right to peaceful protest within the law, but the safety and security of our passengers, aircraft and colleagues together with the smooth running of the operation is paramount."
